thread.title: 'I Have a Bomb and Am Not Afraid to Die,' Man Tells 6 Train Riders: NYPD
thread.title_full: 'I Have a Bomb and Am Not Afraid to Die,' Man Tells 6 Train Riders: NYPD

title: 'I Have a Bomb and Am Not Afraid to Die,' Man Tells 6 Train Riders: NYPD
text:
View Full Caption NYPD 
UPPER EAST SIDE â€”"I have a bomb and am not afraid to die," a man told terrified 6 train commuters earlier this month, according to the NYPD. 
After he threatened passenger on the northbound train at East 86th Street about 6 p.m. on Jan. 5, he fled in an unknown direction, authorities said. 
No one was hurt in the incident, authorities said. 
Police released a sketch of the suspect on Tuesday, describing him as 25 to 35 years old, standing 5-foot-5 to 6-feet tall, and last seen wearing a black coat, blue jeans and a knit hat. 
Anyone with information in regards to this incident is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477).
